subject: Re: Hello and a request
author: msm00
full_text:
Actually I've been there many times but still don't see written 
directions. I see the links to the videos, which look wonderful, but 
on a dialup connection, take far too long to download.  Am I missing 
something there? Is there a direct link to the written instructions?

Thanks so much.

Katie

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "purplespacefriend" 
<purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
>
>  Hi, and Welcome Katie;
> 
>  There's instructions on ufo geek's site, just do a goole on UFO 
> geek, and you'll go right to it. There's menu on the left side that 
> should have it listed. 
> 
>  Those RS radios are prabably the most economical way to start 
> experimenting with that method. 
> 
>  Frank-S
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "msm00" <fvshkatie@> wrote:
> >
> > Hi everyone,
> > 
> > I'm Katie, the founder of Fox Valley Spirit Hunters in Oshkosh 
WI.  
> I 
> > have developed a lot of interest in the audio/video aspect of 
> > investigating and was pleased to find this group.
> > 
> > I have a request.  I have been reading up on Frank's box and the 
RS 
> > hack and have been curious to experiment with a gadget of this 
> sort. 
> > However, I haven't gone ahead until now, since I just 
unexpectedly 
> > found an older model 12-470 in our local RS store and snapped it 
> up. 
> > 
> > What I need are written instructions (versus the video) for the 
> > modifications needed.  Unfortunately, hubby and I live in the 
stix 
> and 
> > do not yet have high speed access. THe videos look wonderful but 
> simply 
> > take far too long to download on dialup for us.
> > 
> > Is someone out there in possession of written instructions and 
> would 
> > they be willing to share them?  I would really appreciate it.  
Thx!
> >
>
